questions.question: ……………………….. he comes in time, we will not be able to meet him.
questions.description: Unless expresses a condition. It is similar to if not.

questions.question: …………………………. on tip-toe, he reached for the mango.
Sam, ………………………… was my student many years ago, is now an accomplished cardiologist.
questions.description: In non-identifying relatives clauses, that cannot be used.

questions.question: ………………………… a noise, the cat ran away.
questions.description: The cat heard a noise. The cat ran away. We can combine these two with a present participle.

questions.question: …………………………. hard you work, you will not be able to finish this job.
questions.description: However means it doesn't matter how.

questions.question: The faster you run, ………………………… you get tired.
The mangoes ………………………. I bought yesterday were sour.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses, both which and that can refer to things.

questions.question: If he had listened to my advice, he ……………………………. in trouble.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: The more you study, ………………………….. you remember.
questions.description: In both clauses we use the + comparative.

questions.question: Uma with ………………………… I went to Beijing is a rich girl.
………………………… their best efforts, they could not save her.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It is followed by a noun/noun phrase.

questions.question: ……………………….. you are honest, I will trust you.
